description: Erection of hip to gable roof extension, incorporating 3no Dormer windows to the rear and 1no Dormer window and 2no Velux windows to the front elevation to facilitate a loft conversion
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The facing materials used in the development to which this permission relates shall match those of the existing building(s) unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above, are agreed and that the Planning Condition 18 (Arboricultural Method Statement) of planning permission 21/02136/FUL is hereby discharged subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the details hereby approved.

Plans, elevations and sections are required where a basement is proposed, therefore please provide the following:o 1 copy of existing and proposed sections o Please show light wells and window dimensions on sections o If the proposed works to the basement extend to the front and rear of the property show the distance between basement and boundary.As part of the Council's Local List of Validation requirements this application needs to be accompanied by a supporting 'Lighting Assessment'.  Please provide a copy of this assessment or an assessment explaining why you believe that such an assessment is not required.  A copy of the Royal Borough of Kingston's information requirements and guidance on what the assessment should contain are available on our website at www.kingston.gov.uk/planning.
